conclusion: Analyze forces and use equilibrium conditions to solve for force F.
Forces acting on the ball: tension T, gravitational force mg, normal force N.
Resolve tension T into vertical component T cos θ and horizontal component T sin θ.
For vertical equilibrium, T cos θ = mg, solving gives T = mg/cos θ.
For horizontal equilibrium, T sin θ = N, normal force N balances horizontal tension.
Force F at the top of the rope equals tension T, so F = T.
Substitute T from vertical equilibrium to find F = mg/cos θ.
Final answer is F = mg/cos θ.
